etymologies: late 18th century: from French physiocrate, from physiocratie ‘physiocracy’(see physio-, -cracy)

definitions: a member of an 18th-century group of French economists who believed that agriculture was the source of all wealth and that agricultural products should be highly priced. Advocating adherence to a supposed natural order of social institutions, they also stressed the necessity of free trade.
shortDefinitions: member of 18th-century group of French economists who believed that agriculture was source of all wealth
